intro: Acourtia venturae, commonly known as the Ventura's acourtia, is a rare flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow-orange blooms. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
